stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

preGame:
Well hello there, sports fans, and welcome to the most wonderful time of the year! It is Game One of the Best of Three Playoffs, and we are coming to you live from the perilous, salt-crusted edges of The Cliffside Pitch in Southport! The wind is howling like a banshee with a stubbed toe, and there is enough sea spray in the air to drown a fish! It‚Äôs a magnificent day for some sanctioned mayhem, and the atmosphere is thicker than the skull of a mountain troll! Every single soul in the stands is buzzing because they know the loser of this series gets a one-way ticket to the loser's bracket. Talk about high stakes! üåäüèí

Our hosts tonight are the Southport Narwhals, and boy, do they look ready to defend their turf against the elements! I just saw Malcolm Goer performing his usual pre-game ritual, vigorously rubbing the Trollball on his armpits for that 'extra grip.' It's a smell that would make a necrophage weep, but in this Gale-Force wind, every advantage counts! King Nezmear might be busy breeding werewolves, but his boys are focused on breeding a victory today. They‚Äôre facing off against the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures, a squad that thrives on the very disorder their name suggests! I heard Wolbrom Ariella singing a sea shanty so far out of tune it actually cleared the fog for a moment‚Äîtruly a terrifying display of vocal dissonance! üé§üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è

Dame Terra Monteforte‚Äôs favorite ruffians are looking sharp, especially Alben Diantha, who I saw dipping his hands into a bucket of ice-cold well water. Chilling! While the popularity polls might show these two teams aren't exactly the darlings of the realm‚Äînot like those over-hyped Zmeigorod Snessengers‚Äîreal fans know this is where the grit is! We‚Äôve got rocky outcroppings, we‚Äôve got unstable winds, and we‚Äôve got two teams ready to tear each other limb from limb for a chance at glory. So pull up a seat, ignore the spray of the ocean, and get ready for some playoff Trollball! It‚Äôs going to be a real humdinger! üèüÔ∏èüî•
postGame:
Holy Mackerel, what a display of sheer, unadulterated grit! The Southport Narwhals have taken a commanding 1-0 lead in this Best of Three series, defending their home turf with a 5-2 victory over the Chaos Creatures! The Gale-Force winds were absolutely punishing, but the Narwhals played like they had anchors in their boots and fire in their bellies! It was a symphony of violence from the opening whistle, and I haven't seen this much red on a field since the last time Sir Tanos tried to read a map! ü¶àüí•

Things got off to a roaring start in Center Field when Blanc Fantasia scooped up that troll head like it was a long-lost relative! But the real highlight of the opening minutes was Alben Diantha of the Chaos Creatures absolutely leveling Loralyn Lyndy! Seeing an injury that early really sets the mood, don't you think? It reminds everyone that in the Everwar, death is just a temporary inconvenience, but a broadsword to the ribs is an eternal memory! üó°Ô∏èü©∏

Not to be outdone in the mayhem department, Urata Oriana decided to share the love by injuring Blood Eppes! The crunch of bone was almost louder than the crashing waves! But amidst the carnage, the Narwhals found their rhythm. Fineman Dolhenty, showing off that incredible focus, launched a beautiful shot from Center Field and nailed it! Two points on the board just like that! It‚Äôs enough to make those fancy-pants 'Heroes' like Artorias look like they‚Äôre playing with dolls. üèπüéØ

The Chaos Creatures tried to claw their way back, and Wolbrom Ariella even managed a spectacular interception after Loralyn Lyndy threw a pass that looked more like a prayer than a play! Wolbrom started charging toward the goal, but the Narwhals' defense was like a stone wall. Crescint Sonia eventually put an end to that nonsense by tackling Wolbrom right into the dirt, sending them off to the healer‚Äôs tent for a mid-game nap! üõëüò¥

At Halftime, both teams took a breather, though I suspect the 'breather' involved more smelling salts and stitching than actual rest. When we returned, the Narwhals didn't waste a second! From their own Home Field, Fineman Dolhenty lined up another shot and‚ÄîBAM!‚Äîanother two points! That kid has an arm like a siege engine! The score climbed to 4-0, and the Chaos Creatures were looking more like 'Chaos Mild Inconveniences' at that point! üå¨Ô∏è‚öΩ

But give credit where it‚Äôs due, the Monteforte squad didn't roll over. Fogel Raynold snatched up the ball and Boulanger Procto managed to sink a shot from Center Field to get them on the board! It was a brief glimmer of hope for the visitors, but the Southport crowd‚Äîmostly made up of salty sailors and people who probably don't like Dame Terra's 'dirt wizardry'‚Äîwasn't having any of it! The energy at the Cliffside Pitch was electric! ‚ö°üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è

The violence flared up again in the final minutes. Tucker Hett of the Creatures took out Torey Dannye with a tackle that surely rattled some teeth loose! But the Narwhals had the last laugh. Malcolm Goer, probably still smelling like a locker room after his pre-game ritual, took the ball and went on a tear! He dodged the defense and ran that troll head right into the End Zone for a thunderous dunk! One more point to seal the deal! üèÄüî•

We did see one last bit of nastiness as Cibis Areta injured Raouf Dragone, just for good measure. It‚Äôs that kind of dedication to the craft that keeps me coming back to this beautiful game! Raouf probably won't be reciting any epic poems tonight, unless they're about the quality of the bandages in the medical tent! A truly inspiring display of playoff intensity from both sides! ü©πüìú

So, the final tally stands at 5 to 2! The Southport Narwhals are sitting pretty, while the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have their backs against the wall heading into Game Two. If they don't find a way to stop Dolhenty's aim or Goer's armpit-enhanced grip, they'll be heading to the loser's bracket faster than a goblin down a greased slide! üé¢üìâ

What a day, folks! My boss Lord Orzalon would have loved the carnage, provided he wasn't currently indisposed in a cell. And speaking of cells, let‚Äôs hope the losing team doesn't end up in one after the inevitable post-game riot in New Monteforte! Stay tuned, stay violent, and we‚Äôll see you for the next installment of Tuesday Night Trollball! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! üéôÔ∏èüòà
